models.folders: A container for organizing feeds by topic. Users create folders to group related feeds together.
models.feeds: An RSS or Atom feed source that the user subscribes to. Represents a single blog, news site, or publication.
models.articles: An individual post or item from a feed. Contains title, content, publication date, and read/unread status.
models.starredArticles: References to articles the user has saved for later reading.

relationships: Each Folder contains zero or more Feeds
Each Feed belongs to one Folder (or no folder if uncategorized)
Each Article belongs to one Feed
StarredArticles reference specific Articles by ID

articles.title: Introducing xapi - Type-Safe HTTP APIs in Go
articles.preview: xapi is a lightweight Go library that brings type safety and simplicity to building HTTP APIs. It leverages Go generics to provide compile-time guarantees...
articles.content:
xapi is a lightweight Go library that brings type safety and simplicity to building HTTP APIs. It leverages Go generics to provide compile-time guarantees for your request and response types.

Why xapi?

Traditional HTTP handlers in Go require manual parsing and validation. With xapi, you define your types once and the library handles the rest.

func CreateUser(ctx context.Context, req CreateUserRequest) (*User, error) {
  // Your logic here
}

articles.title: Building September - A Communication Assistant
articles.preview: A communication assistant for people living with neurodegenerative conditions like ALS, MND, or other speech & motor difficulties.
articles.content:
September is a communication assistant designed for people living with neurodegenerative conditions like ALS, MND, or other speech and motor difficulties.

The app uses eye-tracking and predictive text to help users communicate effectively despite physical limitations.

articles.title: Handling Errors in Go - Beyond the Basics
articles.preview: Go's error handling philosophy is straightforward, though sophisticated applications require custom error types and structured metadata for maintainability.
articles.content:
Go's error handling philosophy is straightforward: errors are values. But as your application grows, you'll need more than if err != nil.

Custom Error Types

Create custom error types to carry context about what went wrong and where.

articles.title: Introducing xkafka - Kafka, but Simpler (for Go)
articles.preview: xkafka is a Go library that brings HTTP-like abstractions to Apache Kafka, making it easier to build event-driven applications.
articles.content: xkafka is a Go library that brings HTTP-like abstractions to Apache Kafka. Instead of dealing with low-level consumer groups and partition assignments, you define handlers that process messages.

articles.title: Career Growth - Beyond IC vs Manager
articles.preview: Career advancement involves expanding skills, tackling complex problems, and building influence across multiple dimensions.
articles.content: The IC vs Manager dichotomy is a false choice. Career advancement is about expanding your skills, tackling increasingly complex problems, and building influence—regardless of your title.

articles.title: The ALS Story
articles.preview: Personal narrative detailing an ALS diagnosis journey and its impact on daily life.
articles.content: In early 2021, I noticed my left hand getting weaker. What followed was a journey through diagnosis, acceptance, and adaptation that changed everything about how I work and live.

articles.title: Scaling long-running autonomous coding
articles.preview: How Cursor approaches scaling autonomous coding agents for long-running tasks across large codebases.
articles.content: As AI coding assistants become more capable, the challenge shifts from single-turn completions to managing long-running autonomous tasks.

articles.title: New Safari developer tools provide insight into CSS Grid Lanes
articles.preview: Safari's latest developer tools update brings powerful visualization for CSS Grid layouts.
articles.content: The latest Safari Technology Preview introduces new developer tools for inspecting CSS Grid layouts, making it easier to understand and debug complex grid structures.

articles.title: Is Rust faster than C?
articles.preview: A nuanced look at performance comparisons between Rust and C, and why the question itself might be misleading.
articles.content: The question 'Is Rust faster than C?' comes up constantly. The short answer is: it depends. The longer answer requires understanding what we mean by 'faster' and how both languages approach optimization.

articles.title: Generate QR Codes with Pure SQL in PostgreSQL
articles.preview: A deep dive into generating QR codes using nothing but PostgreSQL SQL queries.
articles.content: Yes, you can generate QR codes entirely in SQL. Here's how to do it in PostgreSQL using recursive CTEs and binary operations.

articles.title: Crafting Interpreters
articles.preview: A handbook for making programming languages. Contains everything you need to implement a full-featured, efficient scripting language.
articles.content: This book contains everything you need to implement a full-featured, efficient scripting language. You'll learn both high-level concepts and gritty details from scanning and parsing through bytecode and garbage collection.

articles.title: Ask HN: Share your personal website
articles.preview: A community thread where Hacker News users share and discuss their personal websites and portfolios.
articles.content: Share your personal website! I'm always looking for inspiration and curious what tools/frameworks people are using these days.

articles.title: Furiosa: 3.5x efficiency over H100s
articles.preview: Furiosa announces their RNGD server claiming 3.5x better efficiency than NVIDIA H100s for AI inference workloads.
articles.content: Today we're introducing the RNGD server, our answer to efficient AI inference at data center scale. Our benchmarks show 3.5x better efficiency compared to NVIDIA H100s.

articles.title: The Trimodal Nature of Tech Compensation
articles.preview: Why tech compensation isn't a single bell curve, but three distinct distributions based on company type.
articles.content: Tech compensation follows a trimodal distribution. Traditional companies, competitive tech companies, and top-tier tech companies each have their own compensation bands that barely overlap.

articles.title: What TPMs Do and Why You Need Them
articles.preview: Technical Program Managers are often misunderstood. Here's what they actually do and when you should hire one.
articles.content: Technical Program Managers (TPMs) are one of the most misunderstood roles in tech. They're not project managers, not product managers, and not engineers—but they work closely with all three.

articles.title: Inside Stripe's Engineering Culture
articles.preview: A deep dive into how Stripe builds software, based on interviews with current and former engineers.
articles.content: Stripe has one of the most respected engineering cultures in tech. I talked with a dozen current and former Stripe engineers to understand what makes it tick.
